statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Mississippi 72, Mississippi Valley State 49
article.story: OXFORD, Miss. (AP) -- Bam Doyne scored 19 points to lead Mississippi to a 72-49 win over Mississippi Valley State on Friday. Jermey Parnell and Xavier Hansbro added 11 points apiece and Brian Smith had 10 for the Rebels (1-1), who have won 10 of the last 11 home openers. Richard Cannon led Mississippi Valley State (0-1) with nine points. The Rebels shot 28-of-63 from the field, including 6-of-12 from 3-point range. Mississippi Valley State managed only 14-of-54, 26 percent, from the field and no player had more than two baskets. The Delta Devils led 15-10 after 10 minutes of play, but managed only one basket for the remainder of the half. Ole Miss led 32-24 at halftime. The Rebels opened the second half with a 17-3 spurt, building a 49-27 lead. Hasbro and Brian Smith hit 3-point shots and Doyne had six points to highlight the decisive run. Mississippi Valley State never got closer than 19 points again. Ole Miss built its biggest lead to 59-33 with 8:23 left on a 3-point shot by Trey Hampton. Ole Miss starting guard Todd Abernethy was injured early in the contest, suffering a blow to the head. Abernethy did not play the rest of the way, but did return to the bench for the second half. Mississippi head coach Andy Kennedy won his debut game at Ole Miss.
